chapter.title: General Principles

para.emphasis: Ergonomics relating to use of an internet application

chapter.para: PMB is a web application, a "WebApp". Running on a web server (see the PMB Installation Guide, Section 1, Installation under Windows, for more information about Apache), PMB benefits from the flexibility of internet applications.

para.emphasis: Don't use the "previous page" browser button.

chapter.para: "Previous page" and "page forward" allow the movement to another page on the internet, it is the same in PMB.

Attention Whenever you see on the screen a message starting with Update do not click on previous page. Whenever you see this message, it is vital to leave the update to finish completely. In general, avoid using previous page if you can achieve the same results by clicking on one of the links visible on screen.
Whenever you reload a page which is the result of a form (for example adding a new volume), the data is resubmitted to the server.
Following the same principle as "Previous page", your browser's "Stop" button allows the loading of a page to be interrupted.

chapter.para: Attention During important operations on the database (additions, deletions), you can not stop the loading of the page without interrupting the update in progress, this could risk deterioration of the integrity of the database.
In particular, do not click the "cancel" button when the database is being restored, backed-up or optimised.
